BiblioData.Title: Reduced striae extreme ultraviolet elements
BiblioData.Abstract: Titania-containing silica glass bodies and extreme ultraviolet elements having low levels of striae are disclosed. Methods and apparatus for manufacturing and measuring striae in glass elements and extreme ultraviolet elements are also disclosed.

Claims.P: 1. An extreme ultraviolet lithographic element comprising:

a titania-containing silica glass having a titania content in the range of 510 wt%, and having a polished and shaped surface, characterized in that the element has a peak to valley striae level less than 0.2 MPa.
2. The lithography element of claim, wherein the glass has a coefficient of thermal expansion in the range of + 30 ppb/[deg.] C to -30 ppb/[deg.] C between 20[deg.] C and 35[deg.] C.

3. The lithography element of claim 1, wherein the glass contains between 6 weight % titania and 8 weight % titania and has a coefficient of thermal expansion in the range of +20 ppb/[deg.]C to -20 ppb/[deg.]C between about 20[deg.]C and 35[deg.]C.

4. A glass boule suitable for making extreme ultraviolet optical elements, said boule comprising a titania-silica glass having a titania content in the range of 5-10 wt.% and a peak to valley striae level of less than 0.2 MPa.
5. The glass boule according to claim 4, wherein said boule has a rms striae level of less than 0.04 MPa.
6. The glass boule according to claims 4, wherein the titania content in the range of 6 to 8 wt%.
7. The glass boule according to claim 4, wherein the glass has a coefficient of thermal expansion in the range of + 30 ppb/[deg.] C to -30 ppb/[deg.] C between 20[deg.] C and 35[deg.] C.
8. The glass boule according to claim 4, wherein the glass has a coefficient of thermal expansion in the range of +20 ppb/[deg.]C to -20 ppb/[deg.]C between about 20[deg.]C and 35[deg.]C.
